abstract.p: Michael Jackson was an American musician. He was a singer, songwriter, and dancer. Many people believe that he was the biggest entertainer of all time. He had millions of fans around the world. Jackson was also known as the King of Pop. He sang many songs that are still popular, such as "Billie Jean," "Beat It," and "Black or White." People loved him for both his songs and dancing. He made a dance move called the moonwalk very famous.

sec.title: Early Years
sec.p: Michael was born in Gary, Indiana. His full name was Michael Joseph Jackson. Michael's parents were Joseph and Katherine Jackson. He had four brothers and two sisters. Michael and his brothers grew up surrounded by music. Both Katherine and Joseph loved music. Joseph used to play the guitar. Soon the brothers formed a group and started performing in local clubs. They called themselves the Jackson 5. Michael was the lead singer. In 1969, the group started recording for a music company called Motown Records. Some of the Jackson 5 songs became big hits, and the group became famous.

sec.title: Master of Music
sec.p: Although he continued to sing with the Jackson 5, Michael Jackson started his solo career in the 1970s. As a result, he now performed as an individual singer. In 1979, his first solo album was released. It was called Off the Wall. It did very well. People liked him as a solo performer. His next album release came in 1982. It was called Thriller. The album had songs like "Thriller," "Beat It," and "Billie Jean." These songs became big hits. The album Thriller won many music awards, including eight Grammy Awards. The Grammy Awards recognize the best work in the music industry. Jackson's later albums, such as Bad; Dangerous; HIStory: Past, Present and Future; Book 1; and Invincible also became popular.

sec.title: Dancing Sensation
sec.p: Even as a young boy, Jackson loved to dance. He was a gifted dancer. His dancing style was different from the dancing style of others. He created a dance move called the moonwalk. This dance move became popular. In the moonwalk, it seemed as if Jackson were moving forward, but he was actually sliding backwards. Hollywood actor and dancer Fred Astaire was a big fan of Jackson's dancing. Over the years, several dancers have tried to copy Jackson's style.

sec.title: Honors, Awards, and Records
sec.p: Jackson received many honors and awards over the years. He set many records because people all around the world loved his music. His album Thriller entered the Guinness Book of World Records as the largest selling record ever. In 1997, Michael was made part of the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame as a member of the Jackson 5. In 2001, he was made part of the Hall of Fame as a solo performer. Michael won thirteen Grammy Awards.

sec.title: Personal Life
sec.p: In 1994, Jackson married Lisa Marie Presley. His wife was the daughter of Elvis Presley. Elvis Presley was a very popular singer in the 1950s and 1960s. The couple was married for nearly two years. In 1996, he married Deborah Rowe, and they had two children. Michael had another child later. Michael Jackson died in Los Angeles, California, at the age of 50.
